review: We went on 9/1/2017 right when they opened.  This is by far the best Red Robin I have ever been to. The staff was very attentive. We didn't have to ask for refills on anything. Chris was our server (I think he was also a bartender?) and he did an absolute wonderful job.   The order was 100% accurate. The restaurant was clean. The manager touched our table to make sure everything was going alright.  We left very pleased with this Red Robin. If we are ever in the area again we will definitely be stopping by.
Had chicken fingers and fries. The honey mustard sauce was amazing as were the fingers and fries.

I'm writing this review as I'm sitting here for 35 minutes waiting to order while my waitress is "hanging out". My husband had to get up to go get her because she was sitting down hanging out with some co workers. I'm so annoyed, I honestly just want to get up and leave. I shouldn't have to tell someone how to do their job. Absolutely disappointed in her service. I had to update this review it's now been ONE HOUR and I still do not have my appetizer. Ridiculous. Anyways, some tall bald guy (im guessing the manager) came over after waiting for our drinks for 45 minutes and mentioned "I'm sorry the drinks are taking a while.. don't blame your server. it is my fault" Okay?? so whoever's fault it is/was i shouldn't have to wait this long.Maybe your understaffed? Maybe its lack of teamwork? Whatever it is, i'm a customer and that's not my fault. i was expecting him to comp or even give us a discount. Nope nothing at all. I will not be back ever again.

We stopped in for an EARLY dinner. The kids enjoyed their meals and so did we. I was decided on the Whiskey BBQ Chicken Wrap before we even arrived. The wrap came with Steak Fries too. I recommend this dish. It was very tasty and I did not feel like a hot air balloon when we left. The kids also had their favorite mini shake. We have passed this place numerous times on the way to the theater or another spot in the center. It was clean inside and the crowd was sparse. Yeah, we walked in at 2:30. The service was good but that little table top paying system is for the birds.

This was our first visit to the Rancho Mirage Red Robin.  We have had much better experiences at other RRs.  Service here was rather slow; the couple next to us arrived much later than we did, and were served at the same time as us. I was not happy with my lunch, which was a "perfectly cooked" (per the menu) seared salmon.  At first, it was quite dry.  I mentioned this to the server, who said she'd let the kitchen know.  (No apology.)  Later in the meal, I came upon a really unsavory part of the fish, and mentioned this to the server as well.  She reiterated that she'd tell the cooks about it.  I wasn't really telling her these problems this in order to improve the meals of future customers, but rather to let her know that I was very unhappy with my meal.  Again, no apology whatsoever.  I found this off-putting, as was the salmon. We both used the restroom on our way out.  My husband mentioned that the toilet in the men's room was covered with urine.  Ugh.  In the women's room, there were signs for the servers telling them how to wash their hands:  specifically, the length of scrub time AND the (very warm) water temperature needed.  I ran the water in the sink for some time, and it never got beyond cold.  So this is where the servers wash their hands? Last but not least, this is a tiny thing, but when we asked for toothpicks on our way out, we were told that they didn't have them.  Surprising for a restaurant, and a very cheap perk to offer. We'll probably try another Red Robin again, but definitely not this one.
lunch today with the family.  Even tho they were very busy, staff including the manager very nice and attentive. very good service and yumm food

This is an overall good Red Robin. The staff is friendly and attentive, food is good, there's never a long wait. However, instead of a 5 star rating I gave it a 3 because the hallway to the bathroom constantly smells like diarrhea. No matter what day I come or what time it reeks. which is weird because the bathroom itself does not smell. Just the hallway. They should maybe get some air fresheners. It's a little hard to stomach or work up an appetite when you want to wash your hands and have to walk through it back to your table.
I heard that the best Chabela in the Coachella Valley is made in the Bar by Jessie...we'll have to check it out!! We love Gina and Courtney our favorite servers too!
The staff is friendly and we were seated quickly. We ordered the mad love burger and it was delicious, perfectly cooked.

Arrived in Palm Desert just as all the restaurants were closing. We usually prefer to dine local, but there was nothing open but the usual chains. Red Robin hit the spot. Friendly and fast service. Hubby said his burger was better than some "gourmet" burgers he's had lately. My Caesar salad was chopped so kind of unusual, but crisp and tasty. And free refills on salad! Football game was on the big screen so that was a bonus.

Usually, it is burgers. Today it was Wraps, Caesar and BBQ chicken. Excellent on a warm day! Also French Onion Soup. Sam Adams Oktoberfest, too on tap. Out server, Mitchell, made every effort to provide exemplary service. Restaurant was very clean. Regards, Andy Gregg, Palm Springs, CA
The burgers were pretty good we enjoyed our food.  I had the classic spinach artichoke dip & The red robin hamburger.  Nice clean environment. Very good service. I enjoyed
While eating your 11.00 burger with shredded old lettuce I am kicking myself for not going to Wendy's for the Daves Double.  Yeah- fast food. Seriously?
Had a great experience today. Food was good as always and the server, Mitchell, was on point! Thank you.
Whiskey River Wrap is so good.  I only took away 1 star because they are always so slow.  Like, always.

Sat at the bar with a couple of beers and chicken wings while waiting for my tires to be replaced.  The beer was ice cold and the chicken wings were very satisfactory.  Service was attentive and friendly.

My wife and I go here quite often. It's usually good, but it seems like lately the French fries are not as good as they used to be. They get hard very fast, and even if they bring you out more, it's the same thing. It didn't seem this way in the past, but maybe they changed the cooking oil. Hopefully they remedy this problem, otherwise when you only eat a few good ones, it doesn't seem like you are getting your moneys worth.

Just walked out of this restaurant, by far the worse service ever. We got seated right away because it's was 4:20 and the place was not full at all. We had servers make eye contacts with us as people still kept coming in gradually and we started to realize that the people that came in after us started getting their orders in. So not worth it. But walking to Burgers & Beer right next door was so much better

Our waitress Gina I think it was? She was very rude to my family and I, and should not be working for this company. Rolling her eyes, and bringing out our food incorrectly. My family always tips well over 20% and for her to treat my family the way she did, she didn't even deserve what we left her. They need to do something about her. For me to take time out of my day to write this lengthy review about one individual shows how bad the service actually was. I will not give my business to this company anymore nor will I tell refer anyone to this place.

Dinner here last night w/ friends before a movie. Ladies had Cobb salads, I had the crispy Arctic cod sandwich, the other hubby had a whiskey river burger. Decent food, good onion rings and fries. Service was top notch. Friendly and efficient. Service - 4 stars, old looking lettuce - 2 stars. Overall - 3 stars.

Happy Birthday to ME! As a member of the Red Royalty, I get a free Gourmet Burger at Red's.  My wife and I arrived just after six on a Saturday night - movie night - and the place was packed. We were told there was up to a 40-minute wait but we could eat at the bar. Rather than wait and get hungrier and hungrier, we opted for that.  I decided on the A.1 Peppercorn Burger, normally $11.89. She got the small Red's Tavern Double, which is a very good deal at $6.99.  We enjoyed our burgers - yummm! The service was fine except they brought her fries instead of the requested salad. Maybe the server couldn't hear over the din because, as I mentioned, the place was full of people and it was very noisy. But still it was a nice time. Here's a little hint: whenever you get a free or discounted meal like this, figure your tip on the total price as it would be if it wasn't discounted. Otherwise if I had gone in by myself and had only water, the tip would have been zero. The server has to work just as hard even if the business takes a hit. OK?

It should not take over 2 hours to eat at a Red Robin after sitting at your table. It just shouldn't.  Our waitress was very nice but very busy. Somehow we watched table after table sit, get their order taken, be served, eat, get their check, and leave before us.  We asked various wait staff for refills on drinks and additional bottomless items and waited forever for them to come.  Yes, it was dinner time on a Saturday night. I get that. However, restaurants ought to be prepared for that--and it didn't feel uncomfortably crowded.  We will not be returning.

I don't usually enjoy chains, but I have kids now, they are young, busy and noisy at times. So we decided to eat here. It's a fun place with cool decor. Balloons for the kids were a big hit, but I'm not sure the other guests thought so.  The fries are endless as well as the kids sides. Even though my kids split a meal the waitress still gave the kids more mandarin orange pieces when they finished there first order. I'm sure she didn't have to do that.  If you have kids this is a great choice.

Great menu and service if a bit lower end. I like the wide variety in the menu. Our server was absolutely great. We were in a hurry and promptly took our order and served us. Our peach ice tea was too sweet and mixed it with the right amount of unsweetened tea. Our Ensenada Chicken dish was tasty and it paired well with the bottomless broccoli. All in all a good lunch.
Really delicious burger! service was excellent, food was excellent! great family environment! Love this place!!

I feel like I eat at the same places whenever I'm in the desert... so decided to give Red Robin a shot for dinner. We were seated quickly, since we had just missed the busy dinner rush. We ordered our drinks and appetizers and they came out quickly too. I ordered the chicken Caesar salad with extra chicken and a side of french onion soup... the soup was just OK. Wasn't very hot, so the cheese on top sort of just stayed in one large mass. Had to cut it up with my spoon, and I quickly gave up. The salad was good, but I had to ask for extra salad dressing... it didn't seem like they put enough dressing. It started off as just lettuce and chicken. Overall it was pretty filling. I think you'd have to ask for extra chicken. My friend ordered the croissant BLTA sandwich. Half of the sandwich came with good slices of lettuce, while the other half had shredded taco lettuce. They had to have run out halfway making her sandwich. Kinda funny... Overall it was a decent meal. It's a chain restaurant... can't expect to have a flawless experience.

I've been here twice and had a 5 star experience the first time. And a 2 star experience the second time. So I decided to give this a chain the benefit of a doubt with a 4 star average.  First time I went, the service was awesome, fast, friendly. And the food was quick and tasty. BOTTOMLESS FRIES! Had a pina colada what that was dangerously delicious. Left super happy and efficiently. Second time we decided to dine here, we were sat immediately in the back of the restaurant, then moved to a different table because the waitress said she might forget about us if we weren't in the front seating area... okay no big deal, we gave our drink orders and mentioned we were kinda in a rush because we had a movie to catch. Waitress came back and we gave our food order. I wanted to substitute my burger patty with the vegan party and all was well. Waitress didn't come back until 15 minutes later and said they were out of the vegan patties but tried to sub me the veggie patty. Didn't care for that and just wanted fries. She insisted I try the veggie patty and that she would comp our whole meal. Very generous but it was a very uncomfortable situation. Manager stopped by to give her condolences and the food came 6 minutes after that. At that point, we asked them to wrap it up to go. Sat in my car and unwrapped my burger, to take a bite full of pickles!! I was so upset lol hate pickles and just had that one serving of fries.  All in all, I would come back

So good! I love that they have gluten-free buns and know how to prepare meals completely gluten-free. They accommodate severe allergy to sensitivity with knowledge and without the "annoyed look on their face"! Kudos! The meal was delish and service was super good! You

This place is getting 5 stars solely on service. It's been a long time since somebody was this on point in a chain restaurant. Food came out in proper order and time enough to have our salads and appetizers before our meal. Drinks were filled before they were empty, and the general attitude from all of the staff was just awesome. The food was good, but again, the staff made this visit. Keep up the great work! Thanks everyone, we will definitely be eating here again.

We just ordered from Grubhub and we're excited that Red Robin joined. Upon receiving the order, one house salad was missing and a big long white hair sticking out of the Togo container for the Ranch dressing. After calling Grubhub customer service, our representative called Red Robin to explain and they maintained all items in the bag. They did not acknowledge the hair nor the missed item and refused to Credit or resend a side salad.  Grubhub, the consummate professionals honored a future Credit on behalf of the mistake. Decent service in the restaurant, but don't order Togo.  Quality control and customer service should be of utmost importance in the food and beverage industry.

Food was pretty good. Bacon burger, avocado salad and kids Mac n cheese.  I'd give the food rating 3.5 to 4 stars.  Overall rating is 5 stars because of our experience with our awesome server, Andrew who checked on us just enough times, super friendly, attentive and professional. I'd return because he was that good.  Thanks Andrew!

Wow. I was really impressed today by Red Robin. The inside was clean and the decorations were nee and retro. The service was extremely speedy. Food was pretty good as well. Good job Red Robin. I might be back.

Every so often...you have to indulge.  So, yesterday was the day. We came here to redeem my son-in-law's birthday burger. He got the A1 peppercorn burger, I got the classic red robin burger with provolone and my daughter got a burger with avocado. Of course the bottomless fries were delicious. My 2 year old granddaughter ordered for herself (we were very proud of her!) and she politely asked for the 'macroni cheese' :-) My son-in-law shared his birthday sundae with my daughter and granddaughter...while I enjoyed a chocolate shake. Diet buster!!!! Service was a little slow but we enjoyed our meal.

We called and placed an order of 4 clucks and fries and 4 freckled lemonades.  12 minutes later we arrived and they were ready. The amount of fries and chicken was absolutely ridiculous! The box wasn't even a quarter full.  Talk about teeny portions. On the plus side, the person taking our order was friendly and the food was pretty good.

This is their famous red royal burger.  Formally, the heart attack burger. Which comes with a micro egg.  Forget about the incompetent servers,  we are used to that,  but the micro egg. Shame on you guys.  I think corporate need to come to this establishment and help the management out.
Pretty good food for a chain restaurant. Not exceptional but you can always count on a decent meal. Very good service. Great bar. One of our go to places when we are in the area.

I was recommended to try Red Robin and I'm somewhat glad that I did. One of their many burgers that I love getting is the red tavern double. I've only had it once but even writing about it now I feel like I should be heading there for one. They add extra cheese which melts and covers the meat with absolute perfection. It was delicious. The only thing I would say is that service is slow especially during peak hours and there was one particular waitress that seems like she preferred being elsewhere. It was a great meal only marred by a grumpy waitress.

The food was great for the price. They cooked the burger just the way I like it.  It was a little busy and our waiter kept going behind the bar and we couldn't get his attention so we had to ask another waitress to get us water and order more beer which was a bit of a hassle. But the staff were all nice, friendly and helpful.

If you crave incredible noise levels, poor service and lousy food...you will love this joint. Also be careful, they will try to charge you $1.99 entertainment fee for ???? Go to the McDonald's nearby, cheaper and better.

Haha. Had happy hour artichoke dip and teriyaki nuggets. Loved the price. Ordered a side salad and garden burger. Plus a fish burger. I actually had to turn back in the garden burger. It was the worst burger I'd ever tasted. I've eaten out for over decades and I've never returned a dish. That one went back so fast.
Had a beautiful lunch with my two daughters and, my in son n law nice and clean place.Awesome service

Tonight I had dinner with my family. I ordered the artichoke & spinach dip with chips as my favorite the whole reason why we came here. I specifically asked for our appetizer before our main course, our waitress brought out our main course first without even mentioning our appetizer. We then had asked her to cancel it she asked to cancel what. We stated what we wanted canceled and she said "Oh, they never brought it out?" Obviously not lol, so she said well I'll take it off the bill. Later I specify the main reason choosing to eat there because of the dip she says I can have them wrap it up so you can take it home. That sounded perfect, until I came home to find not even half of the appetizer I order.
I am a fry conneseuir and they definitely have the best fries and they're bottomless not too soggy not too crunchy just right and their ranch to dip it with is the best I've ever tried
Why oh why do the two of us always feel sick after eating the mushroom burger here?  It is so tasty and yet we end up with upset stomachs.  I think it's time to stop coming here.

Wow what a surprise! As we were waiting for our food to arrive our server explained that the kitchen was a bit backed up and asked if we would like fries while we wait? Well of course! As soon as the fries got there Joe the manager came by and apologized immensely and comped our entire lunches! And again I say WOW! Thank you so much Joe! This is not my first visit and obviously will not by my last!

Literally have been sitting at the bar for about 15min and not one staff member has greeted me, they've passed me by and not acknowledge me....wait she just said hello...pweee thought this night was gonna be horrible

I'm being generous and giving this place three stars due to nostalgia in the years past it was an enjoyable experience but the past two years  my wife & I always get squeezed into a tiny booth the booth next to their bar the floor has mold growing in the grout and it is gross being sitting next to that seeing that before you eat a meal, they have an older male caucasian server I think his name is Mike or Bill he is very overbearing he's been there quite a long time he means well but he gets on your nerves. On to the food my wife's favorite meal is a prime rib dip which says it comes with coleslaw and french fries they give you literally one tablespoon of coleslaw which their coleslaw is pretty good and when you complain about that they say it's a garnish well then don't listed on the item in the menu as being a side garnish and sides are completely different things in a restaurant. They're one redeeming factor and I think the best thing on their menu surprisingly is there cod fish and chips, the second best thing on their menu is there fried mushrooms and zucchini their burgers are never hot enough and always have too much dressing the tomatoes on their burgers are paper-thin.

I normally have always been happy with Red Robin, this location, I will likely never visit again. Whether it was the half hearted welcome from a hostess who barely made eye contact, to the booth at which we were sat that had yet to be wiped off yet we were sat there anyhow. After we cleared items to one side of the table the waitress states, oh that table needs to be wiped off, ya think!? My visit was 29 May, in the evening, waitress was Noel, and she did do a solid effort in salvaging our visit. After receiving a draft beer which tasted awful (805 was simply not up to standard that night) she replaced it with another selection and made sure it was not charged. Originally I had asked about what IPA's were available on draft, I was given a quick verbal listing of all available beers, which was incorrect since I later saw a full listing on the wall in chalk.... if you don't know what you offer, why should I want any of it? The food was minimally acceptable by Red Robin standard, however the ranch dressing was watered down somehow, I was tempted to make a video, dipping a fry into dressing shouldn't resulted in said dressing dripping off the fry like it was milk. Watching another staff member in a black polo shirt converse with a customer/friend about the hockey match on, while noticing the menu's and other items on the table were sticky and dirty and likely had not been cleaned in quite awhile made me feel like leaving... however, the food was warm, but in a "high-end" burger joint, when the first good point that comes to mind is "food was warm" .... that means you seek another location. The issues with my visit do have one thing related, management, all of these things show it is they that need replacing, dirty items, menu's, poor server knowledge, lack of enthusiasm, are all things that don't exist when management is solid, when it's not, again, you find another location.

I have been really liking Red Robin burgers lately.  From what I remember in the past they have gotten way better.  Cant beat the bottomless fries!  This location, the staff was fun and friendly, service was great.  Thinking about it now and I might go there tomorrow and grab a burger.  :-)

What can you say? It's a Red Robin. I had not been here in quite a while, and was pleased to see that they had expanded the menu, which now includes some smaller (I think they were called "Pub") burgers.  We sat in a booth in the bar area, and the service from the bartendress was prompt and super-friendly. They had also installed a device on each table that allows you to order another beverage, and even pay your bill.  The ambiance is a bit too sterile for my taste, but I have no complaints about the food or drinks.
Between Phoenix and Southern Cal and between Palm Springs and Orange County this is our go to family restaurant. Friendly service, open until 10PM on weekends. Recommend: YES

Came last nite.    Service was excellent all staff were friendly courteous and helpful. Ordered the mushroom fries and beef n bleu burger which was excellent n flavorful....  hadnt had a burger for awhile and definitely recommend their signature burgers. Salad didnt come with much dressing but waitress was able to get more quickly..... dressing was intentionally made fresh n warm?  That was new to me but tasted good nevertheless.... guess in europe the beer is warm too so definitely something different...tasty all the way. Will be back to try more variety! Very cool burger stools in the lobby!

My guess and I arrived at approximately 530. There was a 30 minute wait to be seated for a party of five . We sat in the bar and had a drink until we were called. They took us to a booth that would seat eight . One of the guests is disabled and to our overweight . This booth was at least 2 inches less clearance on both side than their standard tables . It was so noisy that you couldn't hear yourself talk and unfortunately I had two kids behind me that never stop screaming . I ordered the prime rib dip . It wasn't prime rib it was just Roastbeef overcoat no flavor . My 90-year-old mother ordered the mac & cheese . It was dry hardly had any cheese in it and just horrible tasting another one of my guests ordered the shrimp and chicken also overcoat and tasteless . The other two meals were just okay . The highlight of this meal was the server she was great . This was our first time at the restaurant and based on the experience there's not a snowballs chance in hell that will ever go to another red Robin .
Very disappointed that Red Robin decided to no longer use rye bread which we loved on our burgers so it limits are coming here

Such a great experience here. Haven't tried Red Robin in a while but came here to try the burgers and bottomless fries. Ordered the freckled lemonade which was amazing and also bottomless with the refills. Don't recall the name of it but also ordered the burger with the egg on top and it was absolutely delicious. The older gentleman server we had was very attentive and a pleasure to be around as well. Great place!

I don't know who management is, but there is certainly no pride in quality control at this Red Robin. Such a shame, because I typically enjoy the atmosphere and taking the family there numerous times. Tonight, just me and my wife. She had a salad and I had the Ensenada Chicken platter, which also comes with a salad, which I asked for Olive Oil and Vinegar. First off, I asked for two chicken pieces and the server only brought one.  Okay, I can overlook that as an honest mistake, no harm. BUT THEN, I get the oil and vinegar.... Oh my gosh, if I posted a pic, you'd be disgusted. Visually, I saw the containers were full of crud on the outside, oil or who knows what. I used a napkin to wrap around it in order to use it. Yup, napkin stuck to the oil one. The vinegar one was just somewhat sticky. Then, the first of the chicken breasts was over done...just about rubbery. Yes, I ate it. Sauce made it tolerable. Then the 2nd breast came. That one was perfectly done. I go back thinking my last visit was a fluke and it can't always be that bad, but I gotta say, my last few visits have been anything but great. I believe this is a lesson learned. I'll be avoiding Rancho Mirage for awhile. There are many other choices for spending my money on dining out.

If Jessie is not your waitress in the bar area then walk out..she is incredibly friendly, attentive, polite, knows menu, and sets the bar high.  The other waitresses are amateurs....she needs promoted...her talent is being wasted. She should be a regional trainer....don't overlook her for too long...she might get taken away!

Went for my granddaughters 18th birthday dinner and the service was great! Andrew was our server and he has a great personality, very attentive and a great smile! The food was cooked perfectly. The atmosphere here was inviting. I will definitely keep going to this location because it's always good!
Great service (thanks Noel), and great food! Manager even stopped by to make sure everything was good.

They got us off to a slow start. Took a few minutes to get seated due to a slow host, then several minutes to be greeted that we almost left. We stayed and everything was good from there. Still, I think Burgers & Beer in the same lot has better burgers.

After getting stuck on the 210 to the 10 Freeway Transition headed to Phoenix, I got hungry. All that waiting in traffic made me warm up and gave me an empty stomach. With the help of Yelp, I found a safe bet at Red Robin's in Rancho Mirage.  I had arrived around 7pm Friday evening and Rancho Mirage was bloody windy. I had to run from the movie parking lot to Red Robin's front entrance. This Red Robin's was pretty packed. There was a wait of about 5-10 minutes. I am not sure if the crowd was because of the movie theatre or the trip to/from Phoenix or it was just Friday for Rancho Mirage. This was one busy location that I have ever seen. Probably more packed than any Los Angeles store locations. My name was called up and I was under the care of my server, Nicole. Like my last Red Robin's visit, I had a hankering for my favorite dish. Right away, I had ordered the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap with, of course, bottomless steak fries ($10.19). Don't forget, I don't drink soda anymore. Water is my drink of choice. The wait for my order is about 10-15 minutes. During my observation, the place was always filled. Once a party left, the busboys cleaned the table and the table was ready for the next party.  Another server brought my food to my table and I was surprised it was not Nicole. I am not sure if that is how the procedures works, but it was surprising to me. However, Nicole did check on me on occasion. I've noticed that my order of the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken was smaller than usual. My hands can wrap around it several times over. The taste is consistent like the other Red Robin's locations, but the value for the size I ordered was not consistent. Also, the amount of fries that I received did not fill the metal cup on my plate. I did ask Nicole for more fries, but the first dish should have plenty of fries upfront. I was not at all satisfied with the meal, but it was close to satisfactory as I could get this Red Robin's to meet my criteria. However, it was close to a fail. My road trip to Phoenix had only one memory that I don't want to remember, but I have to. Well, I think I need to get my Red Robin's Royalty Card soon. Too many visits already...or not not enough?! Yelp! The One Stop Place For Your Everyday Research!

The quality of the food use to be much better.  I wasn't sure if it was because we had a new waitress or if it was the cooks, but everything we ordered came out wrong and took a while to fix.  They also have a new electronic pay tablet at the tables that you have to pay it out on your own.  We were not too thrilled with it as it seems odd that u have to check  out on ur own and do a survey just to pay the bill.

So I never thought I would rate a Red Robin five stars. They deserve it just for the customer service. First the hostess Olivia was super nice and put up with my seating request.  My waitress Sherri  was amazing and didn't give me the usual hundred questions I get when I say no drink and had my food done exactly the way I requested. I eat a minimum of 10 meals on the road a week and if I ate everything as presented on the menus I would be 300 lbs. again. I totally wish this Red Robin was in my hometown because I would visit everyweek. I'm a pain in the butt when I travel as I usually want quiet seating so I can be on the computer doing a conference call. The staff here was amazing so if they can put up with me they should take great care of you!

A few weeks ago I dropped in for a burger and wine after a movie, I decided to sit at the bar. The burger and fries were cold,  the wine glass was dirty as the bar area itself.was. What troubled me was watching the blonde waitress who picked up the drinks for the other tables dare take the straw in the drink and put her bare fingers on top of the straw mixing the drink........then some poor customer would drink from the straw.............she did this several times with other orders........someone obviously was never trained in the food industry that that's a NO NO................WHO KNOWS WHERE HER HANDS HAD BEEN. If an inspector ever walked in they would have been closed down Never will I go there again.  And a cold lunch didn't help.

Much better here than the LQ site. Jennifer the waitress was very comical. And got us what we needed before we needed it. The food was much better at this site! Would give 10 if I could!! She was amazing with my kids!!! Will come back and request her as our server!!!! AAAAAAA

Food was very good... a great large Bacon Cheeseburger & my wife's prime rib sandwich was delicious ..the bottomless fries were old & cold ..our waiter in the bar was not very good as he had just 3 tables then 2 & it took till we were done with our burgers/sandwich for him to finally get us some fresh fries....then my favorite another 10 min for our check & no offer for dessert. ..  naw not again for a while ! A very lazy waiter as I watched him talking to fellow employees by the POS system. ..

Food is always great. We love taking the family here for our out nights. The rewards program really pays off, so have the card in your wallet. The service was a little slow last night, but we're pretty sure our server, Courtney, was new. She didn't too bad. The place was really busy. Try the uberburger. It is an Oktoberfest special burger with bratwurst on it. Yum! The fireball punch slam cocktail awesome too.
I will make this brief. The service was bad, our orders were wrong. When we finally got the right orders the food was good. I will not be back anytime soon however.

Not sure why everyone has had such a lousy time here. I love this place! What's especially amazing is that you can use their mobile app to tweak each menu item and remove things to accommodate your specific dietary needs. Example: I'm doing low-carb, so I can tweak the French Onion Soup in order to make it zero carbs (no croutons, no garlic bread, no onions!). Love, love, love!
Standard Red Robin. It's close to I-10, in case you're traveling through town.
Lots of gluten free options...the Turkey burger & bottomless fries good for a cheat day.

I'm done with this red ribbon. My second time extremely disappointed. Go there for lunch today and sit in the bar area ( all the bar tables are vacant and just a few booths with customers). My friend and I order soup and salad. More people land up coming in for lunch and fill up the tables area of the bar. Needless to say 45 minutes later, after everyone that came in after we did ordering burgers and sammy's got their food before us. I walked up to the bar counter and asked about my soup and salad. A few minutes later we got our food, and had to take it to go. The soup was tasty, but pretty sad for soup and salad. I won't be going back.

We are big fans! Red Robin has added more affordable menu items which has been a big hit with our family. We were just there last week and were astounded by the customer service we received. It was exceptional!

Overall a great experience with very good food. The burgers are not huge but very tasty and filling. The bottomless french fries are definitely one of the better attributes of the menu. We came in with a large group of around 15 people including children and it seemed to be a little bit much for the cook staff. The food did not all come out at the same time and the majority of the food was not really hot and that was a little bit of a problem. The burgers salad and milkshakes were very good though and our server was wonderful. We will definitely be back.

This place has great service & the usual Red Robin food. Everytime I've come it's been a good experience, the bar is getting better beer & good to watch your favorite sporting event. The art & pictures are the also the usual Red Robin decor, I would come back here for sure.

Standard burger fare.  Not my favorite burger place,  but it'll do if you don't have lots of options.  Outside of the interesting decor and friendly staff,  the burgers are so so. I usually go to appease my kids who seem to love it.  They do serve many types of burgers.  My standard here is the red robin burger that comes with the egg. Fries are endless so eat up.  The garlic ones however are 99 cents extra.  Not worth it as all they do is throw garlic salt on it.  I could have done that!

Such a wonderful experience. Morgan was nothing short of excellent with her help concerning everything. We had a horrible experience before we came here and this definitely made our night 1000% better!

Overall I like red robin the atmosphere is very fun, tons of things to look at while you wait for your food. Came to this Red robin while I was on vacation, was not pleased. The waitress I bleieve her name was Ashley wasnt very attentive. Took maybe 10 minutes to come get our drink order. May daughter asked for BBQ sauce 3 times before it was brought to her.plus the BBQ sauce was very watery.

This place as far as food goes is good...yet sadly the service is hit and miss.  You have a 50/50 chance at having an awesome waitress/waiter. The food (no matter what you order) takes forever to come out.  And they always always leave your empty cups on the table...we came here for my dads birthday last week and with 10 of us at a table with baskets of fries, cheeseburgers, and salads...you can imagine the lack of space...now add our 10 glasses and all the prior empty ones.  Basically if your going to see a movie at Rancho 16, plan accordingly, cause the service is SLOW.

The place has the very best l burgers and sandwiches around.    We had a little problem at one lunch and the manager personally wrote to us to make it right.  First class act and now we are back at Red Robin enjoying once again.  Great food and good management totally on top of things.  We are impressed with Andy Mulz and his follow thru. Sit in the bar and hopefully Sherri will wait on you.  She handles the entire bar area and is so efficient and does not forget anything.  She can multi task like no other. Its poetry in motion to watch her in action.

I keep saying this, but I wish you could give a half star.  Red Robin is Red Robin.   If you've been to one, you've been to them all (though this location seems cleaner than most).  They have good burgers.  In fact, the Red's Tavern Double Burger is probably my favorite cheeseburger (better than Morton's, The Counter, and even Portillo's).  It also happens to be salty as hell, but maybe I like it like that.  Add in the bottomless fries and I'm a happy camper.  Now... I don't go to Red Robin all that much because, well... I hate being around screaming kids and there are tons of them at these places. Red Robin deserves 3 1/2 stars (5 stars, though, for that damn Tavern burger).   For those of you staying at Agua Caliente, it's one exit down.  Movie theater here, too.

I stopped by to have lunch on my way back to the office in Riverside. I sat myself in the bar area at a table. The bartender didn't appear to be busy because there wasn't too many people in the bar area. Finally after close to 15 minutes a waitress comes over to take my order. I ordered the whiskey river chicken sandwich and the cherry limeade. My sandwich-which was wrong came before my drink. I found that to be odd because she wasn't busy. My sandwich was a complete disappointment. The service could have been 100% better.. I'll give this place a 21/2.

Hubby and I went for some happy hour drinks Saturday night. Their menu is pretty large. We ordered some appetizers. Our server Carlos was great. Took a bit for our appetizers to come out. Then one came out and he informed us that another server swooped in and grabbed out (by mistake most likely).  To make it up to us.... They took it off the bill and delivered a fresh hot order. Over all it was a great visit. Great customer service. Great management. We had no reason to get upset as they apologized and made it right.
And this is a really good place to grab a bite to eat before going to the movies. Really good burgers and a great happy hour prices for drinks.

Probably just a bad night... The kindest person was the guy at the door who sat me. He sat me immediately, was nice and was the only one who said "let me know if you need anything." Which I thought was a little above and beyond as a host. His name might have been Eric. Not sure. The server arrived after a while and asked if I wanted anything to drink. I told her I definitely wanted a drink but not sure of what yet.. (opportunity to upsell). She responded with, " should I just get you a water?" Her loss. I ordered the teriyaki chicken burger, which is one of my fave burgers and with well done fries. My food came out timely, but the fries were soggy and old already. What a bummer since Red Robins fries are something to always look forward to. I had to ask for a fresh batch, which were tasteless. I loaded it with the seasoning salt, of course. On to the burger, the pineapple was not good. It wasn't even yellow. It was white and not good.  I drank my water half way through my meal and it was not filled back up until nearly the end. The server passed and never offered to refill my water, so I placed it at the edge of the table for them to see. She even dropped off the check without getting the hint. It wasn't until I asked a bus boy to help me get water that I got some.  The service was lacking. There was no attention; needless to say any service at all. She was an order taker and that's all. Food was the worst Red Robins I had been to. I love Red Robins, just not this one.  Servers name? I'm not quite sure, maybe Katie. She was blonde, kinda timid, never mentioned anything about her menu so she didnt seem knowledgeable.

Okay...it's Red Robin and I really like their Royal Burger with the egg over easy on top. So we decided to eat here for that reason and the food was great. The service is horrible and they really push a loyalty card and give you a free meal on your birthday. However, the older couple seated behind us were having difficulty with their server and asked for the manager. Turns out they didn't comp the lady her birthday meal and to top it off the waitress added a game station surcharge to their bill and we had to listen to a "manager" explain to them why they needed to pay it. Apparently he couldn't override this item from their check because employees at this location were handing it out for free and asking managers to remove it when the check arrives. It wouldn't have been so bad but our waitress was so distracted by the mess up with this couple that she fell short on the refills of our drinks, and the whole bottomless fries and sides on the kids meals didn't happen. If you're a fan of being talked to as the collective "WE" and treated like an idiot with your table top swiper/orderer/summon a passive aggressive waitresser then eat here. If not go somewhere else. They're relying too much on technology and forgetting about customer service.

Today's experience was not typical of our past visits, pre Yelp.  Our sever was very friendly, and brought us a loyalty card. However, he only came back to check on our table once, to refill drinks. No one came back later in the meal to see if we wanted more fries, or if we needed more refills.  My husband told me that he believes his salad greens weren't washed correctly, as there may have been dirt at the bottom of his bowl.

My boyfriend and I came in on Thursday for lunch and drinks to celebrate his birthday. Our waitress Jessica was seriously the BEST!!! She was super sweet, attentive and outgoing. She has great knowledge of the menu and the bar. My boyfriend has been a bartender for 11 years and the beer he wanted wasn't available at this location but Jessica really knows her stuff she was able to recommend something very close to what he wanted, it was perfect! Jessica thank you so much for being so fabulous you helped make his birthday special :) And of course the food was great as always!

We came here for lunch and we were seated promptly by the smiley hostess. I ordered an appetizer (onion ring tower) and they were brought out, nice and hot, within 10 minutes. We also had the fish & chips and the red, white & blue salad, both of which were delicious. The service was fast, friendly and and efficient. Will definitely be back again.

Gave positive reviews in the past but this last visit was a real turn off, the burger was better than most seven dollar burger joints but not as good as in and outs $2.20 cheese burger. Thirteen and change is a bit much for a burger, tea and a small salad but i am willing to pay the price the issue or turnoff was the service.   The waiter gave me the bill, I gave him the twenty, he turned to me and asked if I needed any change. Being I have been in the food service industry I consider myself a heavy tipper and was going to leave the change for the server up until he asked if I wanted any change at witch I replied a little. over fifteen minutes went by before he brought my change, being the stubborn person I am I wasn't going to leave without it.  Sad how a waiter can turn a customer, all he had to do is say i will be right back with your change and I would have left all of it for him. There again life is hard and it is really hard when you a stupid.

I love red Robin and yesterday it was my first time here in this location I took my brother and sister out for a special occasion to celebrate but I was very disappointed it being their first time there and getting horrible food The service was not good at all only once she ever came to refill our drinks I took one bite out of my Burger and then left the whole meal there my server obviously knew something was wrong when she asked if I wanted to go I told her no she didn't bother to ask if the burgers okay so I left very disappointing will not be coming back to this location and other drive a few more miles or go to my hometown in temecula!!!

Y'know, the place is clean enough to perform surgery at.  And the bar is ample enough to shortstop a swallow headed for Capistrano..  Yet there's something about it I have NEVER liked.  It's like that Burger King guy with the giant head and the child molester grin is hiding behind my booth..  I'm suprised Red Robin didn't buy that BK spiel once BK wisened up and realized everyone was ridiculing them.  Something just ain't right.. HOWEVER, the GF loves the place and I forsee eating there at least once a week.. Fortunately, the menu is broad enough that I'm sure I'll find SOMETHING I can agree with... Let's take a look, shall we?: Parking is ample, but I sense there is a spot for a Riverside County Sherriff to hide at like a trap door spider and round out his DUI quota...  Speaking of that, there is a Plethora of potent potables to choose from (would you say I have a "Plethora of Pinatas?") so I guess the GF and I will have to arm wrestle over "Who" is "DD" tonight.  The food IS good, AND plentiful, and you CAN use their onion rings to put new tires on your lawn mower.  But there is ALWAYS the spectre of that Burger King Mardi Gras Head sneaking up on me..   IF he does, I'm decking that Pirata like he's never even thought about...  I will wipe that psycho grin off his face like a Dentist with a drill.   ~"GREAT Dusty, you just SHOT the Invisible Swordsman!!"~
I love coming here at sitting at the bar with my husband. A relax feel. I always get the soup and salad combo, clam chowder and Caesar salad. DELICIOUS! My husband gets a burger and bottomless fries.

I was trying to find a place where I can make a pit stop on the way to Palm Springs that my wife and daughter can eat. I stepped into this Red Robin and noticed it was a lot nicer then the one I normally go to. The waiter was very friendly and was very attentive.  There was some initial confusion about who was supposed to serve my table but it wound up being a tag-team effort between two servers who were both excellent. The food came out quick and hot as ordered.  My family was happy with their orders and we were in and out quick so we could go to the Living Desert park for my daughter. Thanks Red Robin!

For the most part, Red Robin is a very good experience. The atmosphere is fresh and clean. The burgers and fries are very tasty, and the presentation is good. My only complaint is many times when I go in there, the wait staff does not write down the order. (That always concerns me that  the order will be screwed up). And lo and behold, many times the order is. Usually not major things, but the little details, like adding lettuce when asked not to, forgetting to bring condiments that were asked for ahead of time. Granted these are minor, and Red Robin is not the only place that does this. Please, Write down that order!

Red Robin food is always the best! Our waitress spoiled us with baskets of fries while we waiting for our food. The manager stopped by to make sure everything was okay. Never ran out of soda. Didn't even have to wait for a table on a Saturday night. RR always makes me happy.
Food is good but service is really slow. Our server took out order correctly but the food took forever to come out. Took a long time to pay as well. Good kids menu though.

It took five minutes for someone to make their way to the front to greet us then five minutes for them to check if they had available seats even though the place was practically empty. The girl came back and told us there was a booth available but then got into a huddle with two other incompetent asshat employees and decided that actually there's going to be a wait because they apparently don't have anyone working on a Sunday night. Apparently about 10 customers puts them at capacity. We were literally the only people in the waiting area, so why the girl was acting like we were asking her to solve a rubix cube is beyond me.  Seemed like they decided to bullshit us based on the fact we had a baby in a carseat with us, which apparently confused the shit out of them because they were baffled as to how to lead us to our table. With every other restaurant (including other Red Robins) the server usually says something along the lines of "This way." Then get this next part... They start WALKING! Then we follow them and BAM you are now at a table. A concept that evidently has yet to be discovered at this location. It's a shame because pretty much every other Red Robin is great. Disorganized dumb fucks. Go across the street where they staff people who could do the job without practically falling on their face.

Lucky I caught them when they just opened.. Having had the most awesomest time at Coachella, we went to Red Robins to eat before driving home. They open at 11am but saw us sitting in our cars and opened at 10:50am for us! SCORE! Their unlimited strawberry lemonade is by far one of my favorite strawberry lemonade's i've ever had. With real chucks of strawberry, it adds the right touch to a warm day! Of course other than the fact that there is unlimited fries, there are three different kinds you can get! Garlic, Parmesan, and regular (their own Red Robin seasoning). They have the BEST onion rings. 5 stars for this Red Robin! Their wraps are better than the burger version. I got the Crispy BBQ chicken wrap and it was way better than their burger version. Also less calories.
what can I say, it's a red robin. Food is always good and the service is always prompt. never had any issues here and we go often. Highly recommended to all.

2nd time at this location when out of town. Free reorders- all you can eat- such as broccoli pretty hard to get timely. Nice server   Free stuff is just hard to get. Was charged for a supposedly free item. Went back to get a refund and it had to be sent to the home office. Wow not easy to get mistakes corrected.
Food here is good like every other Red Robin Like that they have blue moon on draft witch is awesome but servers are ok but need to be a lil more friendly

Dined here for a family lunch. Had a party of 16 and it took them 20 minutes to figure out how to seat that many. Drinks took about 15 minutes to arrive (ordered a pacifico and mostly waters all around). Once we placed our orders, 4 of the entrees were made incorrectly and they charged us on our remade orders which significantly ran our bill up. Food was good, which is why i'm giving it 3 stars.. The service was decent if that.

Stars are for the service. The food does NOT deserve one... Either they just fire the entire kitchen crew and are still on training, because food used to be good. Then again I can't blame the cooks if the ingredients are not the quality you would expect, the food reminded us of Jack in the Box... Wifey burger was so greasy she hardly touch it and it was suppose to be one of their specialty burgers... My was OK only ate half the turkey patty and the steamed broccoli... Never to comeback again... Much better places for overpriced burgers in town.

Use to eat at RR all the time. It's great for kids. Their turkey burgers are tasteless, apparently frozen patties.  Like eating tasteless rubber. Islands burgers are far, far better. Grilled chicken is pretty good. Service is usually ok. Salad tastes like it comes out of giant plastic bags. No rush to go back.
My wife suggested Red Robin. ... I'm not a fan but to please here I went along with it. I'm glad I did. The food was amazing. Sign me up to the fan club.

We typically stop at this restaurant while driving between Phoenix and Los Angeles. In the past, we have enjoyed our stops here for a quick bite to eat, before jumping back in the road. However, today, we entered the restaurant at 1:00, and didn't leave until 2:30. What should have been a 40 minute lunch, took an hour and a half because of horrible service. When we walked in the door, it took the hostess ten minutes to find us a table, even though we were the only ones waiting. Next, it took our waitress 15 minutes to stop by the table. Our food and drinks arrived rather quickly, but after ordering dessert, it took 20 minutes for the dessert to reach our table! 20 minutes! It probably took another 15 minutes for the waitress to cash out the bill! Thank you Red Robin, that was an excellent 50 minutes of my life that I am never getting back!
I love their patty melts. I really enjoyed the friendly service and relaxed atmosphere. Cant wait for my next visit.

Always a good place to grab lunch, food is good and service is quick which is great for a quick lunch during the work week.  The service staff is always friendly and our waitress on this visit Danielle was great, super friendly, and kept my water full. She gets 5 stars!

Bottom Line Up Front: Standard Red Robin. Nothing outstanding about it. Good food, great service, and a clean restaurant. The first paragraph says it all. I ordered the BBQ chicken wrap and soup combo (French onion). It was all delicious. Really good job on the soup because they crisped up the Swiss cheese just the way I like it. The wrap was tasty and filling. My daughter ordered the Mac n cheese with a side salad and the Mac was definitely not from a box, cheesy and cooked well. I gave the 4th star for the excellent service of our waiter. He was attentive, personable, and polite. Kept our glasses full and was quick with our food.

My friend and I tried the Red Robin in R.M., the waiter was extremely nice and took care of us...both the hamburgers we ordered along with our drinks were prefect.  I can't say enough about how great the hamburgers are and the dipping sauces for the fries.

I would start of by saying that personally I'm not so connected to that part of the valley because I have made Palm Springs my home as of 3 years ago and everything I need is close by. However after exploring my menu options at red robin I realized that this place was up there with dine-in restaurants at every affordable prices catering to a wide variety of college students and others. I was inclined to try the root beer float because of the hot weather and later to my happy surprise refills were free. Anyways me and my girlfriend both had the angus burgers her with regular fries which again were bottom less and mine with garlic fries which were exceptionally good and bottom less. Through this whole experience we were lead by a wonderful genuinely happy waitress who I don't quite remember the name of but to describe I would say she was vibrant petite and respectful and all American. Thank you red robin for the quality food you supply I will be back.

Gotta say it's been a long time since I've eaten at a Red Robin....YUM.  But, glad I did.  This particular location was clean, and the staff very attentive.  I had the Chop House Burger which was awesome.  Dad had the Mushroom Swiss Burger which he said was equally delicious.  Endless fries don't forget!!  Join their points program...you get free stuff!!

It tastes like Red Robin, smells like Red Robin, looks like Red Robin. It really is no different than any other location.  I do have to compliment the level of attention to service this location provides. My parents tend to eat here a lot, and they do so for a reason. On a the occasions I tag along, I see the wait staff have essentially memorized their orders and almost have drinks and fries waiting for them. They really make you feel like a friend.  While the food is certainly no type of delicacy, it's quite decent for a chain restaurant. The bottomless steak fries help the cause.  Try the chicken salads and the Whiskey River Chicken Sandwich!
Great burgers and amazing appetizer s. I can eat there everyday.

Went to dinner with the wife.   Was convinced  by he waiter the fish and chips were the best.  Never found out.  They sat at the service window for 10 min,  delivered cold, and then they reheat it by putting it back in the deep fat frier.  The fish came out dripping with greese.  Ate the insides only ,   manager made it good on the bill.   Not sure they would risk loosing a customer over trying to salvage a fish and chips dinner.   Should have started it a new.

Had a most enjoyable time and the food - my burger and fries - were both Tremendous.... Service was above and beyond.  TOTALLY pleased.  I'm sure I will make the trip again soon.  Thank you Red Robin staff.

Just like all Red Robin's the food is good.  However at this location the services was pretty poor.  I had to ask several times for items.  I even had to get up and almost go to the kitchen to get some condiments that we specifically ordered.

For the longest time their staff and customer service was absolutely horrible. I ordered a gluten free burger once from a dead eyed LA wannabe guy server and when I asked for it he said "seriously?" as if it was ludicrous. Yeah dude seriously go get my burger chop chop. Service is a lot better since the remodel. Food is great as always. Looks like they remodeled their staff too.

We have been to this restaurant lots of times, and I can't think of anything about it that is remarkable except for the strawberry lemonade.  We used to love to go there for the breaded and fried zucchini appetizer, but they took that item off the menu. The burgers are pretty good for burgers, but once again, not remarkably good.  When I have strayed away from burgers in favor of entrees listed in their menu, I have been consistently disappointed.   Last time we were there, we ordered the Spicy Wings appetizer, and they arrived nearly burnt from the deep fryer.  At the end of the meal when asked, "How was the food?", we said it was not good pointing to the uneaten wings.  They were taken off the bill without us asking, but afterward we were reprimanded for not complaining earlier during the dining process. (Guess they wanted to have another go at deep frying) Sometimes the guy with the money just can't do anything right!! As more and more good restaurants with a variety of food genres open up in the vicinity around Red Robin, we have been going there less and less; actually we have stopped going there in favor of the Mexican Cantina nextdoor to The Slice.

Great for the family.  Kids meals seem to have shrunk, though.  We convinced the kids to go with the veggies, as RR is cool about letting everyone chow down on 1 order of their refillable fries.  The broccoli came in a tiny cup that was smaller than a side of dressing.  But when I commented about the extra tiny serving, they said free refills are available, so I can't complain. The service was great and they are super fast with drink refills and checking in on you.  First order of fries had been re-cooked, but they happily replaced them with a much fresher batch. My chicken salad was drenched in dressing, so I'll make sure to request it on the side next time. Overall, a great value and atmosphere and one of our favorites.

The four of us ordered 4 burgers, only 3 were cooked and delivered. The 3 burgers were bland and tasteless. Two of the orders included fries. The fries were bland. The food was luke warm. The waiter was snowed and wanted us to order faster. He was courteous but  we couldn't order fast enough for him. The member of our party who's order was lost had always wanted to try Red Robin. We gave him our fries and a taste of our burgers, he feels he did not miss out on anything. All of us have decided the Red Robin will be omitted from our list of eateries on our visits to the P.S. area.
Red Robin is pretty reliable for a hot, juicy burger with big, thick French Fries. It can be messy, so be careful. And, eat the fries while hot. Who likes cold ones?

First time at one of these places, had a burger hankerin' that was well met by the Robin. Drinks were strong and the service was friendly. Lumped in with the Outbacks and Ruby Tuesdays of the world, but honestly I enjoyed this place more than any of the others in the category. Would go back.

red robin is normally one of my favorites to go to but this location and i've tried them a few times and both of my recent experiences have been terrible and both times we have walked out the first ime in march 2014 we were seated and then ignored for way over ten to fifteen minutes after being seated and were acknowledged by eye contact wiith alot of servers but no one ever came to the table ....we left ! on thursday we arrived a red robin at 4:45 pm the restaurant was not crowded at all there was another couple who had arrived before us and they waited for at least five minutes before being seated or acknowledged, so we thought we would be next we waited and waited and waited after several minutes many people running around looking at the entrance seeing that there were several customers behind us no one came . we left ! went to burgers beer and more in the same complex seated right away excellent service. this isnt  a one time thing fior this restaurant they must have big managemnet problems and lack alot of training....wont be back to this one

Usual great service suffered tonight as it took 25 minutes to get our food after  ordering it (perhaps a delay in putting our simple two burger order into the computer caused us to fall behind. ) Then another 5 minutes to get our onion rings.

Burgers are usually at the end of my dinner list, but I decided to stop by after Friday night church service. I must say, I was really impressed with the new look! Very modern-contemporary, it honestly didn't even feel like I was at a burger restaurant.  Courtney was our server, she was super nice & very attentive the entire time. She stopped by to check on us at least 10 times in the 30 mins that we were there. She definitely gets 5 stars!! My little brother & I were very satisfied with our burgers. He had the Calif. Chicken Burger & I had a Banzai Burger.  Courtney very politely & with no pressure brought me a hand held POS tablet where I was able to pay & leave a tip. I thought that was pretty neat!  I have visited this restaurant a few dozen times, but this time around it was a very unique experience.  Keep it up Courtney & team!
I have had nothing but great meals here. The manager on duty did an awesome job in making us feel welcomed and at home. He offers exceptional customer service .

My husbands Berger .. Blue cheese, was overdone and not enuf dressing. Nothing juicy about it as seen in photo! So be specific, order medium and ask for more dressing. Grand kids Bergers were perf for them.  I Had to pay extra for sweet potato fries which are better for you.. Why? Daughters salad was blah. To me, way too $$$ for what we got. Beer was great tho, when it finally arrived!

Haven't at Red Robin for awhile. Seems like shrink their portions by a lot. What's the point of bottomless fries when they give you 8 fries at a time? Clever way of making you feel like a fat ass.  The service wasn't good either. I use to go to Red Robin all the time a few years ago, glad I stopped going based off this experience.

Pretty good experience at this Red Robin. We had to wait for a few minutes to be seated (host was seating other patrons). Because we wanted to watch the football game, we decided to eat in the bar.  Our server seemed to take a little bit longer than normal to get to us. But, when she did, she took both our drink order and our food order. Food was excellent and the restaurant prepared our food according to our dietary restrictions. One thing I noticed, though. I have ordered the tavern double burger w/no bun several times in the last few weeks. This was the first time it was served to me with lettuce and tomato on the burger. Very nice! I will ask for the extra veggies next time I go to Red Robin. We were checked on by the server and everything was perfect. Great experience.

Worst Red Robin I've ever been to and I'm usually a fan. Terrible service, no refills in 2 hours and my order was wrong but it took my waitress until my meal was cold and my husband was done eating for her to actual notice me calling her..  Never coming back that's for sure

Red Robin used to be a family favorite, but no more. We ordered the queso and chips to start, and they brought us about 7 chips, to feed our hungry family of 4. We had to ask for a refill two more times, and still had plenty of queso left...we just got tired of asking and waiting 5-10 minutes in between each delivery. I ordered a burger "pink" on a gluten free bun. It was well done, not other way to describe it. Since I prefer medium rare, it was a huge letdown. The gluten free bun was cardboard I think, worst gf bun I've had anywhere. If only they were a huge chain and could find a really good gf option. Oh wait... The mac and cheese for kids used to include free refills, but no longer. And the bottomless fries were just like the chips...you get like 7 per serving and have to rely on your wait staff to bring continuous refills. Clearly they think they are serving a 5 year old child and not a grown adult male. Service was so slow I imagine they were out back harvesting the potatoes. As I write this I'm sure our un-bussed dishes are still sitting on our table. They have gotten way too cheap for us. I hope the small amount they save on skimping on chips and fries is worth losing formerly loyal customers. So sad.

I'm only giving this place one star because at least the food was good, but that is where anything good ended. The restaurant wasn't that crowded, and it took our waitress 15 minutes to even come over to our table.  We didn't ask for anything out of the ordinary, but she forgot my husband's water, I had to ask her for sweetener for my tea after I had already asked once and we never saw her again. The manager brought our food out, and never asked us if we needed anything. We hadn't had a refill on our drinks after we finally got them, and were unable to ask our waitress since she never stopped or even LOOKED at us to see if everything was ok. I don't know what happened to this place, but it used to be much better. This is most definitely the worst service we have had in a very long time. We usually like to come here after a movie to have lunch...next time we'll go somewhere else.

I love Red Robin, but will never visit this location again. If you are on vacation in Palm Springs (Rancho Mirage), DO NOT VISIT THIS RED ROBIN! We were a party of 12 on vacation and it all started with a phone call. We called and asked if we could get a table and they said yes. Upon arriving, they said they don't take reservations and we would have to split up. The guy that answered the phone first denied saying he could seat us together but finally admitted his mistake. We sit down (at separate tables) and the server got half the orders and then disappeared, forgetting everyone else.  The service and experience was so bad that the manager came over to apologize and offered us a discount off our bill.  Which would have been nice, but he didn't tell anyone else so when the bill came we had another fight on our hands.  Service was bad, manager showed no authority or control over his staff, poor communication, and just a bad experience.   I love Red Robin, but will never visit this location again. If you are on vacation in Palm Springs (Rancho Mirage), DO NOT VISIT THIS RED ROBIN!

What a great place!!!!,.....Everyone is so nice that works there....My Twin Sister Donna and I have a Big Birthday coming up and Red Robin offers a free Birthday Burger.....so,...we went in and got our Big Gourmet burgers to go......Guacamole,..Bacon..swiss...plus fries...YUM!...The bartender gal who took our order was so kind,...so funny...customers loved her...She is one of the reasons we will be back!...We Love Red Robin!!!!.....Debbie and Donna.....
Went in with my husband and 3 kids.  We made it 3 minutes before we had to leave to the red robin in La quinta.  It was so cold! it was like walking into a deep freezer!!! REDICULIOUS!

Usually very good even with the obligatory wait. Today, there was no wait... the order was bagged and waiting when we arrived in spite of the Sunday afternoon crowd (ordered by phone 15 minutes earlier). And when we got home and looked at the food, we knew why it was ready so quickly. It was old food. Cheeseburger that looked like it had been flattened, wilted lettuce, melted and then congealing cheese and dressing, tomatoes that looked like they'd been sliced and sitting in the fridge too long, and the 5 1/2 undercooked fries (okay, maybe there were a few more than that, but just barely) just plain sucked. And the fried fish was so greasy I thought they must have poured it straight from the pot to the box. And for the first time, we couldn't help but notice how sticky the floor was. We'll go back, but I can guarantee than the next time we'll be looking at our order with a critical eye. You expect better from Red Robin, today they failed to deliver.
They sit us with hardly any waiting. Food is always freaking tasty and the place always looks clean.

This is a great place to eat a different burger, when I say different I mean gourmet, been coming to this location for 6 years, never had a bad experience, my family and I came for dinner two days ago, the Onion tower was crunchy and flavorful, boneless buffalo wings were great, I had a burger that comes with a over easy egg on top, it was probably the best burger that I ever had, it was juicy and perfectly cooked, a little pink in the center, this place never disappoint us.

Red robin is one of my favorite places! Get me a whisky river burger and a cookie magic milkshake and we're good to go! Can't go wrong with their juicy burgers and bottomless fries. And their ranch and honey mustard are the best too!

Two years in a row they've accommodated our large group on a walk in basis during the Lutheran Educator's Conference. Our food comes out quickly, the price is great, and our server this year was excellent. She was very attentive and did a wonderful job.
I had a wonderful experience here. Service is great and the new waiter Nick was on point. We try to visit for dinner before each movie. Food was cooked well.

We used to love this restaurant in Colorado so we decided to swing by and get some lunch and a beer.  The whiskey wrap is my favorite and there new sweet potato fries are perfect.  My daughter gets the fish an d chips which I have found pretty tasty but here they were just okay.     You have to try there amazing all you can eat steak fries and dips

I consulted Yelp before heading out. We are located between the two Red Robin's in the area. I'm so glad we came to the Dinah Shore location. Our waitress was Gina. She was quick, polite, and friendly. I asked for my chicken to be cooked a little bit longer than usual and she delivered it exactly as I requested. The manager stopped by to check in on us. Neatly dressed, close short haircut and a quick wit. Very personable. I appreciated that Gina asked for our Red Royalty card & informed me that I was getting my meal for free because I had not used my birthday item yet. The Red Royalty card does come with benefits! Overall, a pleasant experience with tasty food.

I hadn't been to a Red Robin for some time.  The original location in Seattle was a favorite hangout for years.  I'd read about the new "finest" line of burgers, and thought I would try this location out.  So, so disappointing! First, the service was strange. My burger took over 20 minutes to arrive while others all around me received their food in a timely manner. The fries were old and potato-chip crisp. Yuk. By the time I received replacement fries, I was done with my burger.  Finally, the burger was a big disappointment. The flavor was okay, but the beat was a bit dry and I had to give up on the bun about a 1/3 into it because the bottom bun was drenched with grease.  Certainly not worth the extra 5 bucks.  My advice: stick with one of their original burgers.  Even better: eat at the Burger and Beer right next store.
Asked for sum pink in my hamburger to go, but just the edges were brown. Couldn't eat it because it was so raw.

This is an outstanding place to eat.  The staff is professional & very friendly.  The milk shakes are great.  I stop here 3x a week. I'm a bachelor and this restaurant serves my eating daily needs ! Stop in for your self .  I though it was a nice touch when the manager was also working,  greeting customers - nice touch!
One of the best deals for happy hour. $2.50 draft beers is hard to beat these days. The burgers are good, especially their new spicy burgers!

I've eaten at Red Robins in California, Washington -- even one in Vancouver, B.C.  Red Robin has always been pretty good -- until we just had the meal from hell.  First there was the service -- absolutely non-existent.  But the worst was the hamburger I ordered.  It was the Prime Chophouse burger, and it probably was the worst burger I've ever eaten (or in this case, not eaten) in my life.  For starters, the "patty" actually was six or seven small pieces of hamburger on a bun.  But the worst is that this burger was literally swimming in a puddle of grease.  It was truly gross.  We spoke to the manager who seemed overwhelmed at the moment.  It will be a LONG time before we ever go back to this Red Robin again.

the avo-cobb salad apparently does not come with avocado. waste of time and money. I guess next time I should've open the bag looked at the contents double checked all the ingredients basically done their job

Of course the food is good. Most chains have consistent product no matter which location you're at, Red Robin is no different. I had the Royal burger and it was excellent, as were the fries. But service was atrocious! Our waitress took literally 20 minutes just to get our drinks to the table. After another 20-25 minutes a different waiter came up and said our old waitress was not working this section anymore. He wasn't much better. Once our food was delivered he offered to bring us napkins and silverwear, after another 10 minute wait we finally got napkins. The food may be solid, but I won't be visiting anytime soon because of the poor service experience.

I enjoy each visit to Red Robin.  I like the fact that they are open later than many other similar type restaurants which is a huge benefit with my schedule.  The employees  recognize us when we come in and even remember what drinks we like as well as fries with "no salt".  I enjoy the personal touch of the managers stopping by our table just to visit rather than an impersonal "how was your food?"  The food is always good and dependable and there is no question that we will return to this restaurant.

Okay, I seriously have to give this Red Robin a 5 star rating after last night...typically when I go to ANY place, I can never get them to give me what I ordered...but last night, our waiter was on top of it! He got every little side, every minor change in the order correct...he even brought our kids back their little side more than one time, with no one even saying anything! Great food, and a good waiter equals one happy family with a great review!

First off let me say I've always been satisfied with Red Robin. I typically like spicy food, so I ordered the Burnin' Love burger. I'm the kinda guy that eats wasabi in plenty with my sushi. Anyway, about 9 hours after eating that burger my guts started cramping something fierce and the burnin' love burger spent the next hour very unloving lighting my a$$ hole on fire. I will be back to order some of the other wonderful food there, but will never order anything spicy there ever again.

I have to say that if you are on a low carb diet and want the absolute very best protein burger then this is the place. I've had the protein burger at Carl's Jr., In-n-Out and a variety of non-chain places. The way that Red Robin chefs choose the lettuce leaf to wrap their protein burger is a lesson to be learned by all others. And the burger itself is excellent. All other places just slap two pieces of lettuce around the burger. Red Robin chooses the leafs that form an almost perfect hamburger bun. A bit on the expensive side, yes, worth the money, absolutely. If you aren't on a low carb diet it is still a great burger.

Went here for the first time with my boyfriend, and were glad we did. The burgers were cooked perfectly and the portions are just right. My boyfriend took advantage of the bottomless steak fries, he loved them with their special seasoning. Our waiter ( Richard) was great... never had to call him over and ask for something, drinks and napkins, etc were constantly coming. Will definetly come back again!!!

48 MINUTES !!! . . .  just to get our sandwiches . . . SANDWICHES . . . to the table!  My husband and I ordered Soup and Sandwich combos and literally could've sworn we were being filmed for a "Candid Camera" television show to see if we'd freak out over NOT getting our order in a timely manner.  We were not there at the rush hour, it was 8:30 on a Wednesday night! . . . We told the manager and he said sorry (but made no offer to comp us anything for the delay). Other people leaving walked by our table and said THEY had been there for 3 HOURS! Not sure what I was most disappointed about, our awful dining experience or NOT being on one of those cheezy TV shows!

Our group of six stopped by after a local college game.  Big mistake!  Our waiter whom we will call "big D" took our order without writing any of it down.   We had to repeatedly ask for our drinks as sodas came first, then later, bar drinks trickled in and finally, a lemonade.  Once he took our food order, I watched as he stood at his computer, typing, looking our way, stopping, repeat!  After 5 minuets of this, he finally came back and asked us to repeat the order, admitting he had forgotten 1/2 of it. .
